a.title: At the direction of Governor Greg Abbott, school buildings will not re-open this school year. AISD STUDENTS will continue at-home learning through the end of the school year. Click to visit our COVID-19 Updates Page.

img.alt: At the direction of Governor Greg Abbott, school buildings will not re-open this school year. AISD STUDENTS will continue at-home learning through the end of the school year. Click to visit our COVID-19 Updates Page.

a.title: Amarillo ISD is committed to providing continued instruction for students. Click to visit our at-home learning page.

img.alt: Amarillo ISD is committed to providing continued instruction for students. Click to visit our at-home learning page.

a.title: Tips to Help Now. Click to See Our Latest Parents and Schools In Sync Video.

img.alt: Tips to Help Now. Click to See Our Latest Parents and Schools In Sync Video.

div.div: In today’s update, AISD Superintendent Doug Loomis shares his letter to the Class of 2020 about plans for graduation, and we outline important changes in grading policies for the spring semester and end of the school year.

div.a: Amarillo ISD Takes Precautions to Prevent the Spread of Viruses

div.div: As reports of possible coronavirus cases continue to spread across the country and get closer to our community, Amarillo ISD has taken additional steps to prevent the spread of communicable diseases in our schools.

div.a: Seen and Heard at the March 2020 Board Meeting

div.div: Board President Robin Malone started the meeting by outlining social distancing guidelines and said only the critical items to keep the District moving forward would be discussed or acted upon at this meeting.

div.a: AISD Partners with Local Restaurants in Effort to Spark Family Conversations

div.div: Amarillo ISD, in partnership with the Panhandle Restaurant Association, is aiming to get local families talking around the dinner table, passing out thousands of conversation starter cards to restaurants in the community.

div.a: AISD Joins AC, Texas Tech in 2 + 1 Teacher Certification

div.div: Amarillo ISD will partner with Amarillo College and Texas Tech University on a 2 + 1 teacher certification program that will put additional teachers in AISD classrooms as soon as the 2021-2022 school year.

div.a: District Funds DialCare for All Secondary Students

div.div: A student mental wellness program that connects teens to counselors via phone or video chat for mental and behavioral health appointments is now available to all AISD secondary students.

a.title: Latest AISD news and updates regarding COVID-19

div.p:
